page.title: 11Weather Or Not, Horse-Eye
page.content: The ecology of Horse-Eye Level has been influenced by the changing weather patterns of the latter part of the 20th century. The seasons seem to be occurring later each year by up to 2 months sometimes. Whilst in 1984 this area was treated to an extremely hot and sunny summer, in 1985 it was by stark contrast a wet and often windy summer. The winter of 1984/1985 was very cold, with temperatures reaching record levels. The Weather Station in this area has closely monitored the level of rain fall and the amount of sunshine hours and continues to do so. It is read 365 days a year.
